companies.current_policy: Hybrid with specified in-office days - corporate employees required to be in office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays

policy_details.office_requirements: Mandatory Tuesday and Wednesday office attendance for corporate employees
policy_details.flexibility: Approximately 800 South Florida-based employees work remotely or in hybrid capacity. Company downsized headquarters in 2024 to accommodate hybrid work style, moving from 248,989 sq ft to smaller Coral Gables location

companies.key_findings: Ryder System implemented a 2-day in-office hybrid policy (Tuesday/Wednesday) for corporate employees. The company relocated to a smaller headquarters in Coral Gables in early 2024, explicitly designed for hybrid work. CEO stated 'we needed much less office space than we were utilizing' post-pandemic. The new office serves approximately 800 employees, many working remotely or hybrid. Some positions remain fully remote.

companies.current_policy: Hybrid - 3 days in office, 2 days remote for most corporate positions

policy_details.office_requirements: Most business areas require 3 days in-office attendance per week
policy_details.flexibility: Some departments may vary. Internship program offers hybrid and on-site opportunities. Employee reviews indicate management is pushing for increased office presence post-COVID

companies.key_findings: Ace Hardware's Oak Brook headquarters operates a 3-2 hybrid model for most business areas. Employee reviews indicate the company is actively working to increase office presence, with management concerned about getting people back post-COVID. The headquarters was recognized as one of DuPage County's Smartest Workplaces in 2024. Employee sentiment suggests work-life balance has decreased as the company pushes for more in-office time.

companies.current_policy: Role-dependent - clinical roles on-site, administrative and telehealth positions offer remote/hybrid options

policy_details.office_requirements: Direct patient care requires on-site presence. Administrative, billing, coding, scheduling, and telehealth nursing positions available as remote
policy_details.flexibility: Expanded telehealth services (Emory Connected Care) across almost every medical specialty. Virtual desktop infrastructure (EHC Workspace) enables secure remote access for eligible employees

companies.key_findings: Emory Healthcare has not made public announcements about a formal return-to-office policy. The organization offers 100% remote positions in administrative, medical coding, billing, scheduling, and telehealth nursing roles. Clinical positions requiring direct patient care remain on-site. The company has robust virtual desktop infrastructure for remote work. As a healthcare organization, policy appears to be role-specific rather than organization-wide.

companies.current_policy: Role-dependent - clinical roles on-site, select administrative positions offer hybrid/remote options

policy_details.office_requirements: Direct patient care and hospital administrative functions require on-site presence. Some corporate and administrative roles offer hybrid schedules
policy_details.flexibility: Limited remote opportunities available for specific positions. Created after 2022 merger of Advocate Aurora Health and Atrium Health, with headquarters in Charlotte and strong presence in Chicago/Milwaukee areas

companies.key_findings: Advocate Health (formed from December 2022 merger of Advocate Aurora Health and Atrium Health) has not publicly announced a comprehensive return-to-office policy. As the nation's 5th largest nonprofit health system with 67 hospitals and 160,000 employees across 6 states, the organization maintains role-specific policies. Job postings mention hybrid schedules for certain positions. Healthcare industry requires on-site presence for direct patient care and administrative functions in hospitals/clinics. Limited public information available about corporate office policies.

companies.current_policy: Hybrid - corporate employees required in office at least 3 days per week including Tuesday

policy_details.office_requirements: Minimum 3 days per week in-office attendance required for corporate employees, with Tuesday as mandatory day
policy_details.flexibility: Some positions remain fully remote. Policy has evolved from earlier 2-3 day recommendation to firmer 3-day requirement. Employee reviews indicate limited flexibility and strong push for office presence

companies.key_findings: American Airlines requires corporate employees at Fort Worth headquarters and other offices to be in-office at least 3 days per week, including mandatory Tuesday attendance. The policy has tightened over time - earlier guidance suggested 2-3 days, now firmly 3 days minimum. Employee reviews indicate dissatisfaction with the mandate and limited work-from-home flexibility. Some employees report the company 'forced people back in the office' and return-to-work policies are causing work-life balance issues and increased attrition. IT and some specialized roles may have different arrangements.
